basejump
  • Reference

Generate syntactically valid names

These are convenience function that set names() on an object and return the object, without modifying the underlying data.

titleCase(character)

title_case(character)

firstCase(character)

first_case(character)

makeNames(character)

make_names(character)

makeNamesCamel(character)

make_names_camel(character)

camel(character)

makeNamesSnake(character)

make_names_snake(character)

snake(character)

setNamesCamel(object)

set_names_camel(object)

setNamesDot(object)

set_names_dot(object)

setNamesSnake(object)

set_names_snake(object)

sanitizeNames(object)

sanitize_names(object)

sanitiseNames(object)

sanitise_names(object)

Arguments

character

Character vector.
object

Object for which a names() attribute will be meaningful.

Value

Character vector or object with valid names.

Details

  • The makeNames() and *Case() family of functions manipulate a character vector, supporting either camelCase or snake_case.

  • The setNames() family of functions work similarly to makeNames() overall, but are to be used on objects supporting name assignments (e.g. data.frame, matrix, list).

  • sanitizeNames() modifies both colnames() and rownames() to snake_case format, and is generally recommended for clean-up of RNA-seq count matrices containing gene names.

See also

  • magrittr::set_names().

  • stats::setNames().

Examples

# Create character vectors of valid names
camel("RNAi clone")
#> [1] "rnaiClone"
snake("RNAi clone")
#> [1] "rnai_clone"
titleCase("RNA sequencing")
#> [1] "RNA Sequencing"
firstCase("RNA sequencing")
#> [1] "Rna Sequencing"

# Set names on objects
setNamesCamel(head(starwars))
#> # A tibble: 6 x 13
#>             name height  mass   hairColor   skinColor eyeColor birthYear gender
#>            <chr>  <int> <dbl>       <chr>       <chr>    <chr>     <dbl>  <chr>
#> 1 Luke Skywalker    172    77       blond        fair     blue      19.0   male
#> 2          C-3PO    167    75        <NA>        gold   yellow     112.0   <NA>
#> 3          R2-D2     96    32        <NA> white, blue      red      33.0   <NA>
#> 4    Darth Vader    202   136        none       white   yellow      41.9   male
#> 5    Leia Organa    150    49       brown       light    brown      19.0 female
#> 6      Owen Lars    178   120 brown, grey       light     blue      52.0   male
#> # ... with 5 more variables: homeworld <chr>, species <chr>, films <list>,
#> #   vehicles <list>, starships <list>
setNamesSnake(head(starwars))
#> # A tibble: 6 x 13
#>             name height  mass  hair_color  skin_color eye_color birth_year
#>            <chr>  <int> <dbl>       <chr>       <chr>     <chr>      <dbl>
#> 1 Luke Skywalker    172    77       blond        fair      blue       19.0
#> 2          C-3PO    167    75        <NA>        gold    yellow      112.0
#> 3          R2-D2     96    32        <NA> white, blue       red       33.0
#> 4    Darth Vader    202   136        none       white    yellow       41.9
#> 5    Leia Organa    150    49       brown       light     brown       19.0
#> 6      Owen Lars    178   120 brown, grey       light      blue       52.0
#> # ... with 6 more variables: gender <chr>, homeworld <chr>, species <chr>,
#> #   films <list>, vehicles <list>, starships <list>
setNamesDot(head(starwars))
#> # A tibble: 6 x 13
#>             name height  mass  hair.color  skin.color eye.color birth.year
#>            <chr>  <int> <dbl>       <chr>       <chr>     <chr>      <dbl>
#> 1 Luke Skywalker    172    77       blond        fair      blue       19.0
#> 2          C-3PO    167    75        <NA>        gold    yellow      112.0
#> 3          R2-D2     96    32        <NA> white, blue       red       33.0
#> 4    Darth Vader    202   136        none       white    yellow       41.9
#> 5    Leia Organa    150    49       brown       light     brown       19.0
#> 6      Owen Lars    178   120 brown, grey       light      blue       52.0
#> # ... with 6 more variables: gender <chr>, homeworld <chr>, species <chr>,
#> #   films <list>, vehicles <list>, starships <list>

# Sanitize both colnames and rownames
sanitizeNames(head(mtcars))
#>                    mpg cyl disp  hp drat    wt  qsec vs am gear carb
#> mazda_rx4         21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.620 16.46  0  1    4    4
#> mazda_rx4_wag     21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.875 17.02  0  1    4    4
#> datsun_710        22.8   4  108  93 3.85 2.320 18.61  1  1    4    1
#> hornet_4_drive    21.4   6  258 110 3.08 3.215 19.44  1  0    3    1
#> hornet_sportabout 18.7   8  360 175 3.15 3.440 17.02  0  0    3    2
#> valiant           18.1   6  225 105 2.76 3.460 20.22  1  0    3    1
